column4: How can I get mysql to install on Ubuntu 9.1?  I tried 5.0 and 5.1 both got stuck in install.  When I tried to unistall I also had problems.  I now have them deleted.  what should I do to install a working mysql?
where did you try to install them from?
I used synaptic
can you define "got stuck"?
well I didn't write it down but I can try again and tell you.
should I just try install lamp?
sure.  My guess is that you didn't expand the little window that asks you for sql root password.
from tasksel?  You could, if you want it.
no I got that far
huh, that's odd.  Maybe you should try from the command line so you can see any error messages that crop up.
I also tried tasksel but now I have a clean start so I'll try tasksel again
yes this time i'm using the command line with tasksel
after running tasksel and selecting lamp-server I saw no errors and looks like mysql is installed when I checked in synaptic but I see no demon running
what happens if you start it manually?  'sudo service mysqld start'
unrecognized service
try mysql instead of mysqld - I can't remember
when I deleted it I also deleted the files with mysql in /etc/init.d  maybe those were still needed?
uh, apt should have replaced them when you reinstalled
nothing with the word  ls /etc/init.d/*my*  nothing there
did you install the mysql server or just the client?
I installed lamp
well, something's still messed up from before.  Try doing an install --reinstall of the server package
I just ran mysqld-safe and that brings up something
now I see a mysqld running
